instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_3_SCL is the clock line in the SMBUS data line between the trackpad temperature sensor, temperature sensors, and the system management controller(SMC). .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_3_SDA is the SMBUS data line between the trackpad temperature sensor, temperature sensors, and the system management controller(SMC). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message:
good morning, using the HWMonitor the Memory Proximity sensors are at 129 degrees and the ASD test says that the SMC is with a problem. 
    I replaced the <TRANSISTOR>Q5850</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U5810</CHIP>, but it didn't work.  

diode mode:
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_3_SDA</SIGNAL> 0.717
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_3_SCL</SIGNAL> 0.716

Do you have any other sensors that I can test?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message:
You should start disconnecting webcam.
If still the same, then try known good trackpad flex/board and LIO flex/board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message: I have tested all the peripherals.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message:
Which ASD did you run for this board???
The ASD mod for this board was posted hours ago and I bet you didn't made it.

If you really tried all mentioned above, then you have a problem with <TRANSISTOR>Q5860</TRANSISTOR>,
Check its solders and traces to <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message: I have replaced the <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>, SMC, <TRANSISTOR>Q5830</TRANSISTOR>, and <TRANSISTOR>Q5860</TRANSISTOR>, but the cooler is still running fast

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message:
Seems that you have more 129 temps.
Dificil to see which exactly; you didn't even bother to upload the picture with correct orientation.

More temp errors cannot be caused by a particular sensor.
There should be some communication bus issue.

"try known good trackpad flex/board and LIO flex/board"
Did you really try all of them???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message: Now the keyboard and trackpad are not working, but on the Boot screen, the trackpad and keyboard work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message: Can the bios cause a sensor defect?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message:
Check all <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI</SIGNAL> lines.
Before login into macOS, trackpad and keyboard work through USB.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message:
Almost exactly like my own problem. My mac is not running slow, youtube videos are smooth, but cpu stress revealed that it cannot go above 1 GHz. I also have multiple sensors reported 128 deg C. I was not able to create working ASD for my early 2015 Mac. Most probably I will not solve the problem but fix it with diodes in control of the fan to reduce voltage (—i.e. speed) and removing dual mosfet that triggers cpu prochot signal. Doggy fix as master Sorin would call it.

iclub, did you try removing <CHIP>U5810</CHIP> from the board and testing without it? I have seen boards with 90 days warranty sold on ebay without <CHIP>U5810</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message: Didn't try to set the fan to follow a specirfic temp with Macs Fan Control?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message: Yes that‘s part of the fix. Problem is that fan ramps up to the full speed until macos is booted to the desktop. Only then Mac Fan Control kicks in and slow the fan down. Also if one choose shut down or restart, Fan jumps to full speed as soon as application shuts down.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan and slow mac.
threads.message:
On this mac, I changed all the sensors that could cause this: SMC, <CHIP>U5810</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5850</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5860</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5830</TRANSISTOR>...
    I used another trackpad, flex trackpad, IO power, flex LIO, all these parts work. But it didn't work.
     I will try this stopgap solution.
